text: Nothris radiata is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Staudinger in 1879. It is found in Asia MinorNothris at funet and North Macedonia.Fauna Europaea The wingspan is 23–26 mm. The forewings are yellowish grey with the veins streaked with black and with three black dots. The hindwings are light grey.Horae Soc. Ent. Ross. 15 (2-3): 302 ==References== Category:Chelariini Category:Moths described in 1879
title: Nothris radiata
